Voters in Pocatello , Idaho will decide the fate of the city 's non-discrimination ordinance Tuesday .

A2: from denying employment , services or housing based on
RelatedSentence: Pocatello 's ordinance prohibits most businesses from denying employment , services or housing based on someone 's sexual orientation or gender identity .

RelatedSentence: Pocatello 's ordinance prohibits most businesses from denying employment , services or housing based on someone 's sexual orientation or gender identity .
The Pocatello City Council passed the ordinance last June on a 4-2 vote after months of public meetings and several re-writes of the law .
It was a tough sell then and now opponents are hoping it will be an even tougher sell to voters .

This citywide election is the first popular vote on a gay - rights issue since Idaho voters decided to prohibit same - sex marriages in 2006 .

The Human Rights Campaign and the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force have both deployed organizers to Pocatello to provide assistance to the campaign trying to uphold the law .

The vote comes just a week after a federal magistrate declared Idaho 's gay marriage ban from 2006 unconstitutional .
Idaho 's Republican - led legislature has so far declined to consider a bill that would ban it statewide .
